user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_SocketAddrGetPort_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_SocketAddrGetPort_Impl(uint16 *PortNum, const OS_SockAddr_t *Addr)
{
    in_port_t                     sa_port;
    const OS_SockAddr_Accessor_t *Accessor;

    Accessor = (const OS_SockAddr_Accessor_t *)&Addr->AddrData;

    switch (Accessor->sa.sa_family)
    {
        case AF_INET:
            sa_port = Accessor->sa_in.sin_port;
            break;
#ifdef OS_NETWORK_SUPPORTS_IPV6
        case AF_INET6:
            sa_port = Accessor->sa_in6.sin6_port;
            break;
#endif
        default:
            return OS_ERR_BAD_ADDRESS;
            break;
    }

    *PortNum = ntohs(sa_port);

    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_SocketAddrGetPort_Impl:
typedef struct
{
    size_t            ActualLength; /**< @brief Length of the actual address data */
    OS_SockAddrData_t AddrData;     /**< @brief Abstract Address data */
} OS_SockAddr_t
...
typedef union
{
    char               data[OS_SOCKADDR_MAX_LEN];
    struct sockaddr    sa;
    struct sockaddr_in sa_in;
#ifdef OS_NETWORK_SUPPORTS_IPV6
    struct sockaddr_in6 sa_in6;
#endif
} OS_SockAddr_Accessor_t
...
typedef uint16_t  uint16
...
typedef int32_t   int32
...
#define OS_NETWORK_SUPPORTS_IPV6 
...
#define OS_ERR_BAD_ADDRESS (-34)
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The remaining lines in the function do not introduce pointer types or change pointer qualifiers and therefore are not relevant to MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13. Examples: the local scalar declaration of sa_port is not a pointer; the switch/case labels and the assignments to sa_port (from Accessor->sa_in.sin_port / Accessor->sa_in6.sin6_port) are uses of members accessed via an already const-qualified pointer; the return statements and unreachable break are control flow only; and the call to ntohs operates on integer types, not pointer types. Consequently these statements do not need further investigation for pointer const-qualification under Rule 8.13.
